titleStmt.title: A most excellent and famous ditty of Sampson iudge of Israell how he wedded Philistines daughter, who at length forsooke him: also how he slew a lyon, and propounded a riddle, and after how he was falsely betrayed by Dalila, and of his death. To the tune of the Spanish pauin.

notesStmt.note: Verse - "VVhen Sampson was a tell young man".
In this edition, line 2 of heading ends: "and".
Reproduction of original in the Pepysian Library, Magdalene College, Cambridge, England.
